entry.title: Why We Said No To Costco and Yes to Staying Local
entry.content:
A few weeks ago we received an unsolicited email from Costco. 

When I started roasting coffee in 1997 I would have thought that an offer from Costco to supply them with packaged coffee was a gift from the heavens.  The opportunity to supply Canada's second largest retailer is flattering to say the least, but ultimately one that wasn't right for our customers, workers or business...I said no.

Over the 24 year history of our company we've prioritized roasting the highest quality beans available while staying laser focused on freshness.  We've done an incredible job adapting to supplying Kingston and Area with coffee delivered free to their home or office during the pandemic, while maintaining the safest work environment we can imagine.  This adaptation was a result of a monumental effort from our team here, leveraging the fantastic technology that the Shopify platform offers to create online sales, combined with a dogged determination to prevail in the most difficult business environment in the last 75 years.

A couple weeks prior to the outreach from Costco I was appointed to Shopify's "Voice of the Merchant Council" which brings together 15 online retailers from across Canada to provide feedback and insight into Canadian online retail from the merchant perspective.  It wasn't until I began writing down an outline for this blog post that I realized that the reason I can say NO to Costco is because of the support of our customers ordering online.

The Shopify Platform has allowed North Roast to drive the sales that feed our business, instead of relying on a single large customer who would ultimately control our order flow.  That power to control our own sales is more enticing than any offer Big Retail can offer.  The Shopify Platform has given us the tools to climb up the Search Engine rankings for Coffee Roasters in Ontario to near the top of the page, completely driven by volume rather than paying for placement.  This is the spark that ignites "The Flywheel Effect" described in Jim Collins landmark book "Good to Great".  Increased online sales lead to better SEO results lead to better online sales...all organically without cost. 

If it wasn't for the tools we ourselves control, enabled by the Shopify platform, we would have lost control of our sales flow, been forced to sacrifice quality and freshness, all to prioritize a single large customer over the interests of thousands of individual customers who've supported us through the years.

I made the right choice.

Staying Local

entry.title: Finally....Some Great News!
entry.summary:
The response to the pivot to online sales was overwhelming and we can proudly state that we have successfully completed over 15,000 transactions online since the onset of covid-19 in Canada.  This explosion in online sales has created the need for us to expand our roasting capacity. 

More
entry.content:
We are now one year since the first covid-19 lockdown and I want to take this opportunity to reflect and share some fantastic news. We shut our doors to the public on March 18th, 2020 and have kept this protocol in place ever since out of an abundance of caution and prioritization of both customer and employee health and safety. Since making this change we have devoted ourselves to improving the no-contact customer experience by updating our website and hiring an additional delivery driver to ensure that we get your coffee to you as quickly as possible. A lot of hard work has gone into making this change and we are proud of the service we’ve been able to provide throughout this unprecedented year in business. And it seems you agree! The response to our pivoting to strictly online sales has been overwhelming and we are so grateful for your continued support. Your support has been so great in fact that we need to expand our roasting capacity! We are excited to announce that we have purchased a state of the art Probat Probatone Roaster which will increase our roasting capacity by 200,000 pounds per year. Probat is a German Coffee Roaster manufacturer founded in 1868 and is known for producing the worlds finest coffee roasters for world class professional roasting companies.  

Our new roaster is currently in production and we expect to receive it in late May. We hope to have even more great news to share by then.

Until then, stay safe!

entry.title: Hello 2021
entry.summary:
Thank goodness also for our staff who have worked tirelessly through crazy times. Early on we weren't certain what was the best course of action other than to lock the doors and keep each other safe while still serving the community we've built over the last 23 years.  In those 23 years I can honestly say it was the best business decision I've ever made.

More
entry.content:
While every New Year brings the promise of better things, I can safely say that having 2020 in our rear view mirror brings to mind the saying "things couldn't get much worse".  2020 was a horrible year for every community we serve.  All around us are examples of our community members suffering though what 2020 given us.  Good riddance 2020.

Hello 2021!  We have many things to be grateful for and to look forward to.

Incredibly, the medical community has managed to develop vaccines that will keep us all safe.  Our local medical communities have done incredible jobs of tending to our sick and vulnerable and we've all come to realize how important our local Health Units are in keeping us safe.  Thank goodness for them.

Thank goodness also for our staff who have worked tirelessly through crazy times. Early on we weren't certain what was the best course of action other than to lock the doors and keep each other safe while still serving the community we've built over the last 23 years.  In those 23 years I can honestly say it was the best business decision I've ever made.

I can safely say that we will not open to the public until our local Health Unit declares that the Pandemic is under control, likely through widespread vaccination.  Realistically, this is not likely to happen until late in the Autumn.  We are very pleased that our customers have embraced ordering Online, many for the very first time!  Every time we see familiar names come across the screen, we are reminded of how much we miss seeing everyone, and are grateful to still be a part of your coffee routine.

We are absolutely dedicated to Safely serving you through Secure Contactless Pick Up or Free Local Contactless Delivery and promise that when this is all over, we will host a coffee event to celebrate our customers and community.

Stay Safe!

entry.title: Covid-19 Update

More
entry.content:
While we congratulate all businesses that are opening after restrictions were enforced to contain covid-19, we are currently not prepared to re-open our doors to the public.  

Since March 16 we’ve been safely roasting and packaging behind locked doors, while delivering and offering Secure Pick Up of fresh roasted coffee to our customers.  The act of operating as a food processor safely has required the creation of new rules and protocols to protect our staff and customers.  The careful processes we enacted to ensure a completely sanitized environment are not things that we feel we can continue while opening our doors.  It is for this reason that we are NOT easing restrictions, and will instead continue to offer Free Delivery to Kingston and Area, and Secure Contactless Pick Up at our Roastery on Progress Avenue.

Our staff and customer safety are our most important priority and every decision will be measured by our ability to keep you perfectly safe during this unprecedented time.  We will continue to assess the situation and provide updates as required.

entry.title: Covid 19 Precautions
entry.content:
Needless to say, we live in interesting times.

The news is alarming and this new virus seems destined to arrive close to us at some point.  For medical advice please refer to your local Health Care Practitioner or Health Authority for proper directions on preparations and how best to avoid coming into contact or spreading the virus.

The purpose of this post is to inform you of how we are preparing and protecting each other and our customers.

  • We are spraying and wiping all work and customer surfaces with a disinfecting solution hourly.
  • We have placed antibacterial soap in dispensers for customer use in the washroom and a separate hand sink.  Wash hands vigorously for 20 seconds.
  • We have hand sanitizer at all staff work stations and disinfecting wipes where necessary.
  • Our scoops and bins are washed and disinfected frequently and no customer has any access to touch or handle any of our scoops or bins.
  • We are increasing our in-town deliveries free of charge to serve those in our community who don't want to, or can't leave their houses.

We are taking this challenge very seriously, and all staff are acutely aware of the importance of keeping each other, and out customers safe.  

We will update this post as needed.

entry.title: 2019...A YEAR FOR THE RECORD BOOKS!
entry.summary:
What a year 2019 was!

22 years after I founded my coffee roasting business, we have never experienced a year of such growth in both business volume and product offering.  In 2019 we grew an incredible 27% over the previous year and I feel like we haven’t even put our foot on the accelerator yet.

More
entry.content:
What a year 2019 was!

22 years after I founded my coffee roasting business in Kingston Ontario, we have never experienced a year of such growth in both business volume and product offering.  In 2019 we grew an incredible 27% over the previous year and I feel like we haven’t even put our foot on the accelerator yet.

In 2019 we fine tuned the appearance of our wholesale roastery and added another espresso machine specifically for training.  I expect to put our world class La Marzocco Linea Paddle to good use this year. 

In September we also created a program called CAF•FEINE whereby our customers could donate their Loyalty Rewards Points, or purchase coffee for Canadian Armed Services Members serving overseas.  With the help of the Kingston Military Family Resource Centre, to date, we’ve arranged to have this coffee shipped to units serving in Iraq, Qatar, Kuwait, Romania, Latvia and Israel.  This program took 9 months from conception to launch, and resulted in over 175 lbs of coffee being sent overseas to the deserving men and women of our Canadian Forces. 

In 2019, again after months of planning and iterations, we introduced our 100% compostable coffee bag.  This bag has many features including beautiful graphics, the ability to retain freshness, a Roast Date stamp on the back of the bag, and best of all, it’s compostable!

We couldn’t have made such major improvements to our business without the loyal support of our customers and the dedicated work of our staff, who make every effort to inform and serve.

Thank you for an unbelievable 2019 and trust me when I say that 2020 will see even more remarkable improvements to North Roast Coffee and Coffeeco.

entry.title: Cold Brew Coffee Cheat Sheet
entry.summary:
Cold Brew Coffee is everywhere.  Check out your grocery shelves and you'll spot overpriced canned cold brew (likely already past its stale date), commercials for cold brew on television, and high priced cold brew at your local cafe.  We've a better way.

More
entry.content:
Cold Brew Coffee is everywhere.  Check out your grocery shelves and you'll spot overpriced canned cold brew (likely already past its stale date), commercials for cold brew on television, and high priced cold brew at your local cafe.  We've a better way.

Introducing our Cold Brew How To:  Follow these directions and you'll never go wrong.

  • Grab a bag of our special Cold Brew Blend which is already perfectly ground for cold brewing.  Directions are also printed on the back of the bag!
  • Use a 4:1 ration of clean filtered water to  ground coffee.  (100 g per litre of water)
  • Place ground coffee in French press or other vessel making sure to completely wet all grounds thoroughly...STIR
  • Place coffee on counter for 12-24 hours and cover.
  • Filter with plunger from French press or through a mesh/paper filter if using an other vessel.
  • Refrigerate and serve with cold water for iced coffee or milk for iced cappuccino.
  • Remember:  this produces a concentrate and is meant to be diluted with ice, water or milk.
  • Keep in refrigerator for up to two weeks.

entry.title: How To Make Turkish Coffee
entry.summary:
Turkish coffee is easily my favourite way to drink coffee.  Thick, aromatic and sweet.  It reminds me more of dessert than a traditional North American style brewed coffee.

More
entry.content:
c  The equipment you'll need is easily accessed and very reasonably priced...especially if you search the internet for a Turkish Coffee Pot.

What you'll need:

  • A freshly ground African coffee.  Ethiopia or Tanzania are the best choices although Brazilian (South America) is popular as well.  Grind to a baby powder consistency.  You can purchase a grinder specifically for Turkish coffee but it's easier to have us grind it for you.
  • Fresh cold water
  • Turkish coffee pot or Cezve.  Make sure it is suited to the type of heat you are applying.  There are some that work with induction stoves, but double check.
  • Sugar.  Pure cane juice crystals is best, but any will do.
  1. Measure enough water to fill no more than half the volume of your coffee pot.  The coffee will froth considerably and will overflow if you put too much water into the pot.
  2. Heat the water on the stove until small pearls of air appear.  Do not let the water approach boiling.
  3. Add approximately 1/4 teaspoon of sugar per 3 oz of water.  Do not stir.
  4. Add approximately 1 tablespoon of Turkish coffee per 3 ounces of water.  The coffee will rest on top of the water.  Do not stir
  5. As the water heats the coffee will begin to roll and froth.  This happens very quickly and so you'll need to be watchful.  Take your spoon and stir gently.
  6. When a rolling ring of foam forms, turn the heat to low and move the pot away from the element.  Be very careful because the foam can quickly overtake the pot and bubble over.   Bringing the pot to a full boil will break the Crema and ruin the brew.
  8. Keep the pot and contents frothing by lifting and lowering the pot onto the element.  Repeat the froth-settle-froth-settle not more than three times.  Pour a little of the sweet brew into the cups quickly to deposit the Crema into each cup.  Once the Crema is in each cup, pour the rest of the brew into the cups taking care not to disturb the Crema.  You can also use a spoon to place the Crema into each cup...the most senior guest gets the first cup with the best Crema.  

I hope you'll have fun with this and acquire a taste for the best, and arguably the most traditional way of preparing coffee.  There are many variations on how to make traditional Turkish Coffee so you are encouraged to experiment...just no boiling.

entry.content:
Those in the know recognize the Aeropress Brewer as one of the best ways to make coffee at home or on the road.  The "dwell time" or time the ground coffee is in contact with the water, "turbulence" or the vigour with which you stir the brewing coffee, the simplicity of forcing the coffee and water under pressure through a filter to produce and intense brew, and the ease in cleaning all make the Aeropress a barista favourite.

Better still, the BPA free plastic is the most easily transported brewing method, perfect for the cottage, road trips or a camping get away.  We have many many military members who pack the Aeropress on field exercises and any serious backcountry hiker or canoeist knows it is virtually unbreakable.

Priced at a very modest $45.00, the Aeropress goes perfectly with our Espresso Blend or any of the Manual Brew coffees specifically blended for use in Manual Brewing devices.

When you come to our roastery, the most prominent thing you'll notice is the placement of two shipping containers inside the space.  One of these containers serves as our office and the other is a custom built fully functional espresso bar.  When you visit, you will be presented with the most authentic coffee experience you'll encounter anywhere.  Our large 30 kg roaster is on full display for customers to see, we place many of our green coffee bags in the front retail area for customers to review, and of course our wholesale pricing straight from the roaster provides unsurpassed value. 

Our Coffeeco Espresso Bar is a visual marvel where you can enjoy a perfectly crafted cappuccino or manual brew coffee using only our Fair Trade Organic Coffee and Local Limestone Organic Creamery Milk.  

For the time being, we are open Monday to Friday 8am - 5pm and closed Saturday and Sunday but will review our hours in the Fall once we've fully settled in.  We look forward to your visit, but if you can't make it out remember we deliver free of charge anywhere inside Kingston when you order online.

entry.title: Gift Baskets, Wedding and Events Favours
entry.summary:

More
entry.content:
It was recently pointed out to me that we do some amazing things that we don't promote or share with all our customers. One of the things we do is package coffee in small pouches suitable for a single pot of coffee.  This type of packaging is known in the coffee business as fractional packaging or frac packs.

We have a special packaging machine which packages over 500 pouches per hour, and can print custom graphics on each pouch...logos, event details or wedding day details.  We have many different coffees available to package, fair trade, organic, conventional estate coffees or even special limited edition coffees in all different price ranges.  We can even work with you to create a custom coffee blend that perfectly compliments your special day, promotion or event.  

The best thing about this special service we provide is that we don't charge anything extra for this service, you'll pay the same price our wholesale commercial customers pay.  If you are looking for a unique way to show your guests or customers that you've got them covered, reach out to us and let's talk about creating a custom coffee pack that says something about you.

entry.title: Big Changes At Coffeeco Market Square
entry.content:
Tonight I convened a staff meeting at Coffeeco Market Square to inform our team that we have successfully completed an agreement to sell our location at 322 King Street East on Market Square.  The purchasers are the same team who acquired our Kingston Centre location, and will similarly rebrand the location “Kingston Coffee House”.

An important part of this sale is a long term coffee supply agreement to guarantee our existing customers access to the highest quality and freshest coffee in Kingston, Multatuli and North Roast Coffee.

Another important factor is the fact that we are retaining the Coffeeco name which will represent a new “Mobile” coffee concept we are currently building and will introduce at our new larger roastery next door to our existing location at 721 Progress Avenue.  This new concept will see a full functioning espresso bar placed within a custom shipping container capable of being dropped on any vacant lot, parking lot, special event or in our case, within the walls of an existing building.  I’ll post some pics tomorrow of our container in the process of being constructed.

Last, our new larger roasting plant will feature a completely open concept to make the roasting and packaging an interactive process for customers who want to know how their food in made.  We will also have a professional barista training station to permit us to train or upgrade the staff of existing customers, and to hold training events for aspiring home baristas.

entry.title: Last Week At Kingston Centre
entry.content:
This is our last week of operating our Coffeeco Espresso Bar at the Kingston Centre location.  We have enjoyed 8 1/2 years of profitable operation in this busy location, but have decided that we would not be renewing our lease when it expires in 2018, and instead focus on our wholesale roasting operation.  

As mentioned in my previous post, we have agreed to sell this location to a long time employee and her husband, who will operate under the new name of "The Kingston Coffee House".  Rest assured that the new owners will continue to offer our fresh, fair trade organic coffee exclusively, and to continue to bake on site, and offer only organic milk for every drink on the menu.  All customers who have accumulated loyalty rewards points at this location can still use their Gift Cards at either Coffeeco in Market Square, Multatuli Coffee on Progress Avenue or online.  

I expect to be making an exciting announcement regarding the relocation of our Wholesale Roastery, and the creation of a Regional Centre for coffee roasting, coffee equipment, hands on coffee education and espresso training in Kingston.

entry.title: Big Changes Coming Soon
entry.content:
We’re making big changes!

This is our 20th year in the coffee roasting business, and we’re not content to sit still.

 

Back in 2008 we opened an espresso bar at the corner of Division and Johnson Street, after recognizing that no cafes in Kingston were selling proper espresso and cappuccino, and had limited interest in learning how. I’ve been active in the Specialty Coffee Association of America, as a Lead Instructor in Roasting, Cupping and Barista Techniques and felt it time to share the skills I had with the Kingston Coffee drinking public. Since we opened that store, we quickly opened a second at the Kingston Centre, and then relocated the original store to our fantastic Market Square store.

Almost 9 years later, there are many espresso bars serving nice cappuccinos and espresso, including our coffeeco espresso bars, with many of them using our coffees.

While building retail coffee stores puts you in direct contact with customers, it requires a lot of effort, day in day out, which necessarily reduces the amount of time I get to spend at the Roaster, where I like to be.

 

Consequently, I have decided to sell the Kingston Centre Coffeeco store to one of our long time workers and her husband, who will continue to run the location in much the same manner as customers became accustomed but with an expanded food menu. The store at the Kingston Centre will acquire a new name, but will still continue to sell and prepare our North Roast/Multatuli Coffee and serve only organic milk.  This transition will take place March 31.

 

We will continue to operate the Coffeeco at Market Square and focus on Roasting, Wholesale, Barista Training, and Training for home baristas at a soon to be announced 5000 Square Foot Interactive Roastery and Coffee Education Centre.

entry.title: New 1 LB Coffee Bags Coming Soon!
entry.content:
In early 2017 we will be discontinuing our coffee cans and switching to 1 LB Bags.  Bag technology ( there is such a thing ) has evolved a great deal in the past dozen years, and the bags we've purchased stand upright easily on their own, and offer plenty of flat panels to display information that will be helpful to our customers.  We have also purchased a custom colour label printer to make it easier to offer small lots of select coffees, and to frequently update the look of our packaging.

We expect to be adding some small lot special coffees to our offerings, but will continue to focus on Fair Trade Organic Coffees, which provide proven and verified benefits to the small farmers who grow your coffee.

entry.title: Drink Fresh Coffee!
entry.content: I am motivated to post this after noticing a local business advertising coffee as "The World's Finest Fair Trade Coffee". Curious, I sought to uncover who roasted the coffee, when it was roasted, any details about the origins, package date...any of the factors which would support a claim of "World's Finest Coffee". Sadly, the coffee in question had almost no information, although it did have a nice bag with colourful labels. Great coffee isn't roasted hundreds of miles away, months ago, in some industrial factory, or sketchy back alley...it's roasted locally, or shipped directly to the end user, within days of roasting, with a roasting date that you are proud of. We pride ourselves on only selling fresh coffee, on limiting how much customers order so they frequently restock with fresh coffee, and provide maximum transparency to the end user. If you want to see your coffee roasted, come out to our Roastery on Progress Avenue and you can have an impromptu tour and experience the noise, aromas and bustle of fresh coffee roasting. Drink Fresh Coffee!
